citations.narrative:
One adult female Havanese dog was still listed as present on the facility's record of animals on hand (Form 7005) but was
not present on the property. According to the licensee, she was donated a few months ago but they couldn't find a copy of
her disposition record (Form 7006). Having accurate acquisition and disposition records is critical to allow inspectors to
track animals both born on the property and imported into the facility as well as those leaving the facility. Correct by
September 19, 2025 by ensuring that all required disposition information is recorded and that records match the inventory
of animals on site.

Two puppies born on site and an adopted adult female dog are not listed on the facility's record of animals on hand (Form
7005) but are present on the property. One female Yorkshire Terrier and one male Havanese were born from litters on
site and kept for breeding purposes but have not been added to the record of animals on hand even though they are older
than 4 months of age. Additionally, an adult, intact female labradoodle was adopted as a family pet and is also not listed
on the record of animals on hand. Having accurate and up to date records regarding animals on hand (7005) is critical to
allow inspectors to track animals both born on the property and brought onto the property. Correct by September 19, 2025
by ensuring that all required acquisition information is recorded on the required Form 7005.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n
